newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures slip on rising stocks.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures slip on rising stocks.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended lower across the board on Tuesday, depressed by expectations that domestic rubber stocks are expected to rise, traders said.
Prices ranged from 1.5 yen to 2.8 yen per kg lower. Benchmark September was down 2.6 yen at 147.7 yen.

The market started the day on a weaker note, as long-liquidation and technical selling emerged from the outset, the traders said. "Prices have more room to dip as rubber stocks are expected to rise to around the 40,000 tonne level by the end of April," one trader said. The appropriate stock level is around 25,000 tonnes, traders said.
